ref.mixed-citation: Shin DH, Bianucci R, Fujita H, Hong JH “Mummification in Korea and China: Mawangdui, Song, Ming and Joseon Dynasty Mummies”, Biomed Res Int. 2018:1-12, 10.1155/2018/6215025, https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC6158963/ (Accessed 2 April 2020): “Interestingly, Chinese archaeologists reported that some graves dating to the Song and Ming dynasties were completely sealed by a mixture of lime, yellow clay soil, sand, and sticky rice water“.
